sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"火焰，烈火，光"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: blaze, flame, flare, glow, glare, flash, glitter, twinkle, light
means: blaze ： 指猛烈燃烧所发生强烈的光。
flame ： 指一条或多条火舌，多用复数形式，指由许多火舌构成的大火。
glow ： 指像冶炼铁和钢时发出的红光。
flash ： 指突然发出而随即消失的闪光。
glitter ： 指连续发出闪烁不定的光。
twinkle ： 指如星光等的闪烁。
light ： 普通用词，指日、月、星或灯等的光。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"点燃，着火"之意。
means: kindle ： 指艰难或缓慢地把可燃料点燃，可用于比喻。
fire ： 普通用词，指将某物点燃使其燃烧起来，火势可大可小。
ignite ： 多用于科技文体，指使某物受热直到燃烧或发光，也可指用火花使易燃物迅速燃烧起来。
light ： 普通用词，指点燃易燃物，使其能发光，满足各种需要。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"灯"之意。
means: lamp ： 通常指以油、气或电为能源的照明设备，一般有罩。
light ： 普通用词，含义广泛。泛指一切供照明的灯，多指电灯。

word_mean: 光，光线：每秒钟3×1010cm的电磁辐射，在空间的振动与传播方向成直角。通常认为波长介于3900°～7700°埃(＝10－8厘米)间的范围可产生主观感觉的刺激，但有时也考虑包括紫外线和红外线的部分
光切法，light-section method 使与被测物体表面成一定角度的平面光束投射到被测物体上，以测定物体表面微观形状、粗糙度等的方法。
光切显微镜， light-section microscope 利用光切法测量零件表面粗糙度的仪器。其表面粗糙度测量范围为1～100μm。
光诱围网，purse seine 用灯光诱集捕捞对象后进行包围作业的围网

entry.def: Light is the brightness that lets you see things. Light comes from sources such as the sun, moon, lamps, and fire.

example.ex: Cracks of light filtered through the shutters...
example.tran: 斑驳的光线透过百叶窗照射进来。

example.ex: Light and water in embassy buildings were cut off...
example.tran: 大使馆内的水电都被切断了。

entry.def: A light is something such as an electric lamp which produces light.

example.ex: The janitor comes round to turn the lights out...
example.tran: 看门人巡视一圈，把灯熄灭。

example.ex: You get into the music, the lights and the people around you.
example.tran: 你融入到音乐、灯光以及身边的人群中。

entry.def: You can use lights to refer to a set of traffic lights.

example.ex: ...the heavy city traffic with its endless delays at lights and crossings.
example.tran: 在交通灯和十字路口前长久等待的拥堵的城市车流

entry.def: If a place or object is lit by something, it has light shining on it.

example.ex: It was dark and a giant moon lit the road so brightly you could see the landscape clearly...
example.tran: 天黑了，一轮巨大的月亮把道路照得通明，周围的景物可以看得一清二楚。

example.ex: The room was lit by only the one light...
example.tran: 房间里仅靠这一盏灯照明。

entry.def: If it is light, the sun is providing light at the beginning or end of the day.

example.ex: It was still light when we arrived at Lalong Creek...
example.tran: 我们到达拉隆溪时天还没黑。

example.ex: He would often rise as soon as it was light and go into the garden.
example.tran: 他经常天一亮就起床去花园。

entry.def: If a room or building is light, it has a lot of natural light in it, for example because it has large windows.

example.ex: It is a light room with tall windows...
example.tran: 这间房有高大的窗子，光线充足。

example.ex: Her house is light and airy, crisp and clean.
example.tran: 她的房子光线充足，空气流通，清新整洁。

entry.def: If you light something such as a cigarette or fire, or if it lights, it starts burning.

example.ex: Stephen hunched down to light a cigarette...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬弓着身子点燃一支烟。

example.ex: If the charcoal does fail to light, use a special liquid spray and light it with a long taper.
example.tran: 要是木炭确实着不了的话，使用一种特殊的液体喷剂，再用长木片将其点燃。

entry.def: If someone asks you for a light, they want a match or cigarette lighter so they can start smoking.

example.ex: Have you got a light anybody?
example.tran: 你们谁有火吗？

entry.def: If something is presented in a particular light, it is presented so that you think about it in a particular way or so that it appears to be of a particular nature.

example.ex: He has worked hard in recent months to portray New York in a better light.
example.tran: 最近几个月里他努力从更积极的角度来描绘纽约。

entry.def: You can refer to the type of influence that something has on situations, people, or things as the light of that situation, person, or thing.

example.ex: ...the harsh light of reality.
example.tran: 现实严酷的一面

entry.def: You say that something is done or is acceptable according to someone's lights when you mean that it is done or is acceptable according to their own ideas and standards.

example.ex: They can get on with running the school system according to their own lights and in their own interests.
example.tran: 他们可以继续按照自己的想法，依据自己的利益来管理学校系统。

entry.def: If there is a light in someone's eyes, there is an expression in their eyes that shows you the mood they are in or what they are thinking about.

example.ex: I remembered the curious expectant light in his eyes.
example.tran: 我记得他眼里那好奇而期待的目光。

entry.def: If something comes to light or is brought to light, it becomes obvious or is made known to a lot of people.

example.ex: Nothing about this sum has  come to light...
example.tran: 关于这笔钱人们一无所知。

example.ex: The truth is unlikely to be brought to light by the promised enquiry.
example.tran: 承诺要进行的调查不太可能揭露真相。

entry.def: If light dawns on you, you begin to understand something after a period of not being able to understand it.

example.ex: At last the light dawned. He was going to marry Phylis!
example.tran: 终于明白过来了——他要和菲莉丝结婚了！

entry.def: First light is the time in the early morning when light first appears and before the sun rises.

example.ex: Three hours before first light Fuentes gave orders for the evacuation of the camp.
example.tran: 黎明前3个小时富恩特斯下达了撤离营地的命令。

entry.def: If someone in authority gives you a green light, they give you permission to do something.

example.ex: The food industry was given a green light to extend the use of these chemicals...
example.tran: 食品业获准继续使用这些化学品。

example.ex: Other countries are eagerly awaiting an American green light to lift the sanctions altogether.
example.tran: 其他国家正在急切等待美国同意完全撤销制裁。

entry.def: If something is possible in the light of particular information, it is only possible because you have this information.

example.ex: In the light of this information it is now possible to identify a number of key issues.
example.tran: 根据这一信息，现在有可能弄清楚几个关键问题了。

entry.def: If someone goes out like a light, they fall asleep or become unconscious very quickly or immediately.
entry.tran: 很快入睡；立即失去知觉

example.ex: 'Why didn't  somebody come and tell me?' — 'Because you were out like a light.'
example.tran: “为什么没有人来告诉我？”——“因为你一下就睡过去了。”

entry.def: If you say that an object sees the light of day or sees the light, you mean that it is taken out of the place where it is stored.

example.ex: Museum basements are stacked full of objects which never see the light of day.
example.tran: 博物馆的地下室里堆满了永远不会重见天日的物件。

entry.def: If something sees the light of day at a particular time, it comes into existence or is made known to the public at that time.

example.ex: This extraordinary document first saw the light of day in 1966.
example.tran: 这份非同寻常的文件第一次公开是在1966年。

entry.def: If someone sees the light, they finally realize something or change their attitude or way of behaving to a better one.

example.ex: I saw the light and ditched him.
example.tran: 我终于醒悟，甩掉了他。

entry.def: If you set light to something, you make it start burning.

example.ex: They had poured fuel through the door of the flat and had then set light to it.
example.tran: 他们隔着公寓门往里边倒汽油，然后点着了火。

entry.def: To shed light on ,throw light on, or cast light on something means to make it easier to understand, because more information is known about it.
entry.tran: 使（某事）显得非常清楚；使人了解（某事）

example.ex: A new approach offers an answer, and may shed light on an even bigger question.
example.tran: 新的方法提供了一个答案，并且可能让人们对一个更大的问题有进一步的了解。

entry.def: When you talk about the light at the end of the tunnel, you are referring to the end of the difficult or unpleasant situation that you are in at the moment.
entry.tran: 隧道尽头的曙光；黑暗尽头的希望

example.ex: All I can do is tell her to hold on, that there's light at the end of the tunnel.
example.tran: 我只能告诉她要坚持，让她知道总会柳暗花明的。

collins.item: NOT GREAT IN WEIGHT, AMOUNT, OR INTENSITY

entry.def: Something that is light does not weigh very much, or weighs less than you would expect it to.

example.ex: Modern tennis rackets are now apparently 20 per cent lighter.
example.tran: 现代的网球拍据说比以前的轻20%。

example.ex: ...weight training with light weights...
example.tran: 轻量负重训练

entry.def: Something that is light is not very great in amount, degree, or intensity.
entry.tran: 少量的；程度轻的；强度低的

example.ex: It's  a Sunday like any other with the usual light traffic in the city...
example.tran: 这是一个星期天，像任何一个星期天一样，城里的车辆不多。

example.ex: Trading was very light ahead of yesterday's auction.
example.tran: 昨天拍卖之前的成交量很小。

entry.def: Light equipment and machines are small and easily moved, especially because they are not heavy.

example.ex: ...a convoy of light armoured vehicles...
example.tran: 轻型装甲车队

example.ex: They used light machine guns and AK forty-sevens.
example.tran: 他们使用了轻机枪和AK—47步枪。

entry.def: Soil that is light is easy to dig, because it has a loose texture and is not sticky or solid.

example.ex: Less chemical gets into the subsoil which is particularly important with the light, tropical soils.
example.tran: 进入底土的化学物质会减少，这对土质松软的热带土壤而言尤为重要。

entry.def: Something that is light is very pale in colour.

example.ex: The walls are light in colour and covered in paper...
example.tran: 墙的颜色素淡，贴了墙纸。

example.ex: He is light haired with gray eyes.
example.tran: 他浅色头发，灰色眼睛。

entry.def: A light sleep is one that is easily disturbed and in which you are often aware of the things around you. If you are a light sleeper, you are easily woken when you are asleep.

example.ex: She had drifted into a light sleep...
example.tran: 她迷迷糊糊地进入了浅睡。

example.ex: She was usually a light sleeper.
example.tran: 她通常很容易惊醒。

entry.def: A light sound, for example someone's voice, is pleasantly quiet.

example.ex: The voice was sweet and light.
example.tran: 那嗓音甜美轻柔。

entry.def: A light meal consists of a small amount of food, or of food that is easy to digest.

example.ex: ...a light, healthy lunch.
example.tran: 量少而健康的午餐

example.ex: ...wine and cheese or other light refreshment.
example.tran: 酒和奶酪或其他小食品

entry.def: Food that is light has a delicate flavour and is easy to digest.

example.ex: Berti's  clear tomato soup is deliciously light...
example.tran: 伯蒂做的西红柿清汤清淡可口。

example.ex: Bake salmon in foil or poach in a light stock for 8-10 minutes.
example.tran: 用箔纸包烤或用清汤蒸煮三文鱼8至10分钟。

entry.def: Light work does not involve much physical effort.

example.ex: He was on the training field for some light work yesterday.
example.tran: 昨天他在训练场进行了一些强度较小的训练。

entry.def: If you describe the result of an action or a punishment as light, you mean that it is less serious or severe than you expected.
entry.tran: （行为后果、处罚等）轻微的，不严重的

example.ex: She confessed her astonishment at her light sentence when her father visited her at the jail.
example.tran: 父亲来探监时，她承认对自己受到的从轻判决感到诧异。

entry.def: Movements and actions that are light are graceful or gentle and are done with very little force or effort.
entry.tran: 轻捷的；轻盈的；用力小的

example.ex: Use a light touch when applying cream or make-up...
example.tran: 涂抹乳霜或化妆品时动作要轻。

example.ex: There was a light knock at the door.
example.tran: 有人在轻轻地敲门。

entry.def: If you describe things such as books, music, and films as light, you mean that they entertain you without making you think very deeply.
entry.tran: （书、音乐、电影等）消遣性的，娱乐性的，轻松的

example.ex: He doesn't like me reading light novels.
example.tran: 他不喜欢我看些消遣小说。

example.ex: ...light classical music.
example.tran: 轻古典音乐

entry.def: If you say something in a light way, you sound as if you think that something is not important or serious.

example.ex: Talk to him in a friendly, light way about the relationship...
example.tran: 用友好随意的方式跟他谈谈这一关系吧。

example.ex: Let's finish on a lighter note.
example.tran: 最后，我们谈一个比较轻松的话题吧。

entry.def: If you say that something is not a light matter, you mean that it should be treated or considered as being important and serious.
entry.tran: （通常用于否定句）轻微的，不重要的

example.ex: It can be no light matter for the Home Office that so many young prisoners should have wanted to kill or injure themselves.
example.tran: 竟然有那么多的年轻囚犯试图自杀或自残，内政部决不可等闲视之。

entry.def: If you make light of something, you treat it as though it is not serious or important, when in fact it is.
entry.tran: 轻视；对…不在乎；视…为微不足道

example.ex: Roberts attempted to make light of his discomfort.
example.tran: 罗伯茨试图轻描淡写自己的不适。

means.word_mean: 1. (physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation;

sentences.sentence: "the light was filtered through a soft glass window"

means.word_mean: 2. any device serving as a source of illumination;

sentences.sentence: "he stopped the car and turned off the lights"

means.word_mean: 3. a particular perspective or aspect of a situation;

sentences.sentence: "although he saw it in a different light, he still did not understand"

means.word_mean: 4. the quality of being luminous; emitting or reflecting light;

sentences.sentence: "its luminosity is measured relative to that of our sun"

means.word_mean: 5. an illuminated area;
6. a condition of spiritual awareness; divine illumination;
7. the visual effect of illumination on objects or scenes as created in pictures;

sentences.sentence: "he could paint the lightest light and the darkest dark"

means.word_mean: 8. a person regarded very fondly;
9. mental understanding as an enlightening experience;

sentences.sentence: "can you shed light on this problem?"

means.word_mean: 10. having abundant light or illumination;

sentences.sentence: "they played as long as it was light"
"as long as the lighting was good"

means.word_mean: 11. public awareness;
12. brightness and animation of countenance;

sentences.sentence: "he had a sparkle in his eye"

means.word_mean: 13. a visual warning signal;

sentences.sentence: "they saw the light of the beacon"
"there was a light at every corner"

means.word_mean: 14. a device for lighting or igniting fuel or charges or fires;
1. make lighter or brighter;

sentences.sentence: "This lamp lightens the room a bit"

means.word_mean: 2. begin to smoke;

sentences.sentence: "After the meal, some of the diners lit up"

means.word_mean: 3. to come to rest, settle;
4. cause to start burning; subject to fire or great heat;

sentences.sentence: "Great heat can ignite almost any dry matter"

means.word_mean: 5. fall to somebody by assignment or lot;

sentences.sentence: "It fell to me to notify the parents of the victims"

means.word_mean: 6. get off (a horse)
1. of comparatively little physical weight or density;

sentences.sentence: "magnesium is a light metal--having a specific gravity of 1.74 at 20 degrees C"

means.word_mean: 2. (used of color) having a relatively small amount of coloring agent;
3. of the military or industry; using (or being) relatively small or light arms or equipment;
4. not great in degree or quantity or number;
5. psychologically light; especially free from sadness or troubles;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lēoht, līht (noun and adjective), līhtan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch licht and German Licht, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek leukos 'white' and Latin lux 'light'
Old English lēocht, līht (noun), lēohte (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch licht and German leicht, from an Indo-European root shared by lung
Old English līhtan (in sense 2; also 'lessen the weight of'), from light; compare with alight
